SEARCH
Package cesur.accesodatos.file

Class FileDAO

java.lang.Object
cesur.accesodatos.file.FileDAO
All Implemented Interfaces:
FileHandlerInterface, IDAO, Menu
public class FileDAO extends Object implements IDAO, Menu, FileHandlerInterface
File-based Data Access Object (FileDAO) component. Handles file operations for data access. It simplifies reading, writing, updating, and deleting data in files, making sure you're good to go with minimal setup. Designed to be straightforward and user-friendly, it's all about getting the job done without the hassle. Just remember to check your file paths and connections before you start. IDAO for data operations. FileHandlerInterface for file database management. Menu for user related interactions.

  • Method Details

    • findAllEmployees

      public List<Employee> findAllEmployees()
      Retrieves all employees from the data storage file. This method reads the "empresa.txt" file line by line, looking for entries that start with "employee". Each found entry is parsed into an Employee object and added to a list of employees. This list is then returned. The method handles any IOExceptions that might occur during file reading, printing the stack trace to standard error if an exception is caught.
      Specified by:
      findAllEmployees in interface IDAO
      Returns:
      A list of Employee objects representing all employees found in the data storage file. If no employees are found or an error occurs, an empty list is returned.

    • findEmployeeById

      public Employee findEmployeeById(Object id)
      Searches for and retrieves an employee by their unique identifier from the data storage file. This method iterates through the "empresa.txt" file, identifying lines that represent employee data. It parses each employee entry and checks if the employee's ID matches the specified id. If a match is found, it constructs and returns an Employee object representing that employee. If the id provided is not an instance of Integer, or if no employee with the specified ID is found, the method returns null. IOExceptions encountered during file reading are caught and handled by printing the stack trace, but do not stop the method from returning a value.
      Specified by:
      findEmployeeById in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the employee to search for. Expected to be of type Integer.
      Returns:
      An Employee object representing the employee with the specified ID, or null if no such employee is found or if an error occurs.

    • addEmployee

      public void addEmployee(Employee employee)
      Adds a new employee to the data storage file. This method formats the provided Employee object into a string representation following the format: "employee(id,name,position,departmentId)" and appends it to the end of the "empresa.txt" file. This allows for the persistent storage of the new employee's information. The method utilizes a PrintWriter wrapped in a BufferedWriter and a FileWriter configured to append to the file, ensuring that existing data is not overwritten. IOExceptions are caught and handled by printing the stack trace, but the method itself does not return any value.
      Specified by:
      addEmployee in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      employee - The Employee object containing the information of the employee to be added to the file.

    • updateEmployee

      public Employee updateEmployee(Object id)
      Updates an employee's details in the storage file based on the provided ID. Validates the ID, then prompts for and accepts new values for the employee's surname, job, and department ID. Updates both the in-memory representation and the persistent data in "empresa.txt". If the input ID is not an integer, the employee cannot be found, or input values are invalid, the operation will fail. IOExceptions during file update are caught and logged, potentially causing the method to return null.
      Specified by:
      updateEmployee in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the employee to be updated, expected to be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The updated Employee object if successful, or null if an error occurs.

    • deleteEmployee

      public Employee deleteEmployee(Object id)
      Removes an employee from the data storage file based on the provided ID. This method first identifies the employee to be deleted by iterating through all employees. If found, the employee is removed, and the file is updated to reflect this change.
      Specified by:
      deleteEmployee in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the employee to delete.
      Returns:
      The Employee object that was deleted, or null if the ID is not valid, the employee is not found, or an error occurs.

    • findAllDepartments

      public List<Department> findAllDepartments()
      Retrieves all departments from the data storage file. Parses each line that starts with "department" into a Department object and collects them into a list.
      Specified by:
      findAllDepartments in interface IDAO
      Returns:
      A list of all departments found in the file. Returns an empty list if no departments are found or an IOException occurs.

    • findDepartmentById

      public Department findDepartmentById(Object id)
      Searches for and returns a department by its ID from the data storage file. Parses lines starting with "department", comparing the ID with the provided search ID. If a match is found, constructs and returns a Department object.
      Specified by:
      findDepartmentById in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the department to find. Should be of type Integer.
      Returns:
      A Department object matching the given ID, or null if the ID is not an Integer, the department is not found, or an IOException occurs.

    • addDepartment

      public void addDepartment(Department department)
      Adds a new department to the data storage file. This method formats the provided Department object into a string and appends it to the end of the "empresa.txt" file. The format used for the department data is "department(id,name,city)", ensuring consistency with the file's data structure. If an IOException occurs during the file writing process, the stack trace is printed.
      Specified by:
      addDepartment in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      department - The Department object containing the information of the department to be added.

    • updateDepartment

      public Department updateDepartment(Object id)
      Updates the information for an existing department based on the provided ID. If the ID is valid and the department is found, it prompts for new values for the department's name and city. These new values are then updated in the department object and the "empresa.txt" file to reflect the changes.
      Specified by:
      updateDepartment in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier for the department to be updated, expected to be of type Integer.
      Returns:
      The updated Department object if the operation is successful; null otherwise.

    • deleteDepartment

      public Department deleteDepartment(Object id)
      Deletes a department from the data storage file based on the provided ID. It first finds the department to be deleted. If found, the department is removed from the list of all departments, and the file is updated to reflect this change.
      Specified by:
      deleteDepartment in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      id - The unique identifier of the department to be deleted, expected to be an Integer.
      Returns:
      The Department object that was removed, or null if the ID is invalid, the department is not found, or an error occurs.

    • findEmployeesByDept

      public List<Employee> findEmployeesByDept(Object idDept)
      Retrieves a list of employees who belong to a specific department. Validates the department ID before proceeding to ensure it's an integer. Then, it iterates through all employees, adding those to a list whose department ID matches the provided department ID.
      Specified by:
      findEmployeesByDept in interface IDAO
      Parameters:
      idDept - The unique identifier of the department whose employees are to be found. Expected to be of type Integer.
      Returns:
      A list of Employee objects who are associated with the specified department ID. Returns null if the provided ID is invalid.

    • executeFindAllEmployees

      public void executeFindAllEmployees()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to display a table with all Employees stored. This method displays all Employees information in a table view from a list that is returned by IDAO's corresponding method, that will be called inside. If the returned list is empty, a message notifying it will be shown.
      Specified by:
      executeFindAllEmployees in interface Menu

    • executeFindEmployeeByID

      public void executeFindEmployeeByID()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to display an Employee found by its ID. This method asks the user for a numeric ID and execute the corresponding IDAO's method. If an Employee is found, the toString() method is displayed, if not an error will be shown.
      Specified by:
      executeFindEmployeeByID in interface Menu

    • executeAddEmployee

      public void executeAddEmployee()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to add new Employee. This method asks the user for all required information to create a new Employee. If any input from user is not good, an error will be displayed and the method execution stops. If all inputs from user are good (all data is valid), the corresponding IDAO's method will be executed.
      Specified by:
      executeAddEmployee in interface Menu

    • executeUpdateEmployee

      public void executeUpdateEmployee()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to update an existing Employee. This method asks the user for a numeric ID, checks if there is an existing Employee with that ID and if so, executes the corresponding IDAO's method. If there is no Employee with the ID, an error will be shown.
      Specified by:
      executeUpdateEmployee in interface Menu

    • executeDeleteEmployee

      public void executeDeleteEmployee()
      Description copied from interface: Menu
      Method to delete an existing Employee. This method asks for a numeric ID, checks if there is an existing Employee with that ID and if so, executes the corresponding IDAO's method. If there is no Employee with the ID, an error will be shown.
      Specified by:
      executeDeleteEmployee in interface Menu
